suncertify.gui
Class ConfigOptions

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.gui.ConfigOptions

public class ConfigOptions
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents the user configuration options that are filled in the ConfigPanel of the user interface.

Version:
1.1
Author:
Pedro Oliveira
See Also:
ApplicationMode

Constructor Summary
ConfigOptions(ApplicationMode mode, java.lang.String dbPath)
          Constructor for the standalone application, creates an options object only using the application mode and database location.
ConfigOptions(ApplicationMode mode, java.lang.String dbPath, java.lang.String port)
          Constructor for the networking mode, where the options are built using the location of the database and server in the network and the port number where the server is listening.
 
Method Summary
 ApplicationMode getApplicationMode()
          Returns the mode the application was invoked.
 java.lang.String getDbPath()
          Returns the database path which may be a file location in the local machine or a url, ip address or hostname depending on the application mode.
 java.lang.String getPort()
          Returns the port number the server is listening.
 void setDbPath(java.lang.String dbPath)
          Sets the location of the database to the given path.

          Sets the port number with the given port value.

Constructor Detail

ConfigOptions

public ConfigOptions(ApplicationMode mode,
                     java.lang.String dbPath)
Constructor for the standalone application, creates an options object only using the application mode and database location.

Parameters:
mode - the mode the application was invoked, the valid options are STANDALONE, NETWORK or SERVER.
dbPath - the path to the database file.

ConfigOptions

public ConfigOptions(ApplicationMode mode,
                     java.lang.String dbPath,
                     java.lang.String port)
Constructor for the networking mode, where the options are built using the location of the database and server in the network and the port number where the server is listening.

Parameters:
mode - the mode the application was invoked, the valid options are STANDALONE, NETWORK or SERVER.
dbPath - the URL or ip address to machine where the server is running..
port - the port number of where the server listens.
Method Detail

getApplicationMode

public ApplicationMode getApplicationMode()
Returns the mode the application was invoked.

Returns:
the mode the application was invoked, the valid options are STANDALONE, NETWORK or SERVER.

getDbPath

public java.lang.String getDbPath()
Returns the database path which may be a file location in the local machine or a url, ip address or hostname depending on the application mode.

Returns:
the dbPath to the database.

getPort

public java.lang.String getPort()
Returns the port number the server is listening. A blank field means the application was invoked in a standalone mode.

Returns:
the port number where the server listens.

setDbPath

public void setDbPath(java.lang.String dbPath)
Sets the location of the database to the given path.

Parameters:
dbPath - the location of the database.

setPort

public void setPort(java.lang.String port)
Sets the port number with the given port value.

Parameters:
port - the port number where the server should listen.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Overrides:
